owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment: The Industrial Maintenance Ontology IMO aims to model industrial maintenance concepts (predictive and corrective). It covers three scopes : 1)Infrastructure, 2) Eventing with failure handling and 3)Resources. Infrastructure scope handles structural concerns of the domain (i.e, organization and composition) like relationship between elements of interest, physical or digital : Entities, Functions, Properties, etc. and some of their specialization. The Eventing scope covers Event concepts like Failures, Errors, Sensor, triggred alarms and related Diagnosis informations like Causes, Effects and Recommanded Actions. Third scopre covered by the ontology is Resources. It defines concepts like Documents, Procedures, Agents, etc. The Ontology reuses concepts from widely used ontologies like Smart Applications REFerence Ontology SAREF, Semantic Sensor Network Ontology SSN, FOAF, etc.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relates an event to an active agent (a person, a computer, ... )
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasAgent

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relates an event to a passive factor (a tool, an instrument, an abstract cause...)
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasCause

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relates an event to an object.
Relates an event to something produced during the event---a sound, a pie, whatever...
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: products

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property provides a way to split a complex event into simpler ones.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasSubEvent

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A related resource that is included either physically or logically in the described resource. Relation between a Platform or System and its smallest Components (parts) .
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasPart

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A related resource in which the described resource is physically or logically included. Relation between a component (e.g piece or part) and bigger Entity : System or Platform.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: isPartOf

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment:
The DUL:hasPart relation without transitivity, holding between an Object (the system) and another (the component), and assuming a Design that structures the Object.
A related resource that is included either physically or logically in the described resource. Relation between a Platform or System and its atomic Components (parts) .

The DUL:isPartOf relation without transitivity, holding between an Object (the system) and another (the component), and assuming a Design that structures the Object. A related resource in which the described resource is physically or logically included. Relation between a component (e.g piece or part) and grouping Entity : System or Platform.
Supports the association of a temporal entity (instant or interval) to any thing
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasTime

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between a Platform and a Sensor, Actuator, Sampler, or Platform, hosted or mounted on it.
Relation between a Sensor, Actuator, Sampler, or Platform, and the Platform that it is mounted on or hosted by.
Relation between an Observation and the Sensor which made the Observations.
Relation between a Sensor and an Observation made by the Sensor
Relation between a System and its subsystems.
Indicates a member of a Group
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: member

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relationship between a certain entity (e.g., a device) and the task it accomplishes.
A relationship indicating a composite entity that consists of other entities (e.g., a temperature/humidity sensor that consists of a temperature sensor and a humidity sensor)
A relationship specifying the property that can be controlled by a certain device
A relationship identifying the function of a device
A relationship between a metering function and the measurement of the reading
A relationship between a feature of interest and a property of that feature
A relationship between a sensing function and a measurement identifying the range of a sensor detection.
A relationship identifying the sensing type of a sensor detection (i.e., Temperature, Occupancy, Humidity, Motion , Smoke, Pressure, etc.)
A relationship for identifying the state of a production equipment. A relationship identifying the type of state of a device.
A relationship associated with an event function to notify that a certain threshold measurement has been exceeded
A relationship identifying an entity (e.g., a device) that can accomplish a task.
A relationship specifying the devices that can control a certain property
A relationship specifying the devices that can measure a certain property.
A relationship identifying the unit of measure used for a certain entity.
A relationship between a service and a device that offers the service
A relationship between a property and the feature of interest it belongs to
A relation between a device and the measurements it makes. Such measurement will link together the value of the measurement, its unit of measure and the property to which it relates.
A relation between a measurement and the device that made it.
A relationship specifying the property that can be measured by a certain device
A relationship between a device and a service
A relationship between a property and the measurements it relates to
A relationship between a measurement and the property it relates to.
A relationship between a service and a function.
A relation between a physical space and the objects located in such space.
Relation between a building or a building space and the spaces it can be divided into.
A relation between an object and the physical space in which it is located.
Relation between a building space and the building or building space it belongs to.
Link between an entity and its category
A relationship determining the International Registration Data Identifier (IRDI)
link between an entity and its unique identifier.
A relationship determining the Universally Unique Identifier (UUID)
Link between a category and its associated entity

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The nature or genre of the resource. Classification of an Entity into groups according to some characteristics. Example : Velocity pump, Gravity pump, Steam pump, Electrical pump, etc. are different types of pump.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: type

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A process that an Entity (physical or digital) uses to complete a task. Example : Cutting, Data processing, pumping, etc.

Indicates the importance level of a machine, Component or System in the industrial process and its impact (security, financial, etc.) on the overall process. Example : given a one-to-five rating, 5 would indicate a critical machine or process.
The place or position that an Entity is in.
Degree of severity rating for an Issue. Example : On a one-to-five scale, 1 is for low or insignificant. 5 for severe or critical.
State or condition at a particular time of a given Platform, Component or System. Exemple : KO, UP, RUNNING, etc
For a server or bucked up process, "P" denotes the primary node and "B" the backup node.
A relationship identifying the manufacturer of an entity (e.g., device). The value is expected to be a string or a string with language tag. The Constructor of the machine or System.

A relationship identifying the model of an entity (e.g., device). The value is expected to be a string or a string with language tag. A model reference to distiguish between different generations of the same tools, machines with the same or a slightly different functions.
A relationship stating the timestamp of an entity (e.g. a measurement).
A relationship defining the value of a certain property, e.g., energy or power. Note that, even if numeric values are expected to enable reasoning, measurement values could use other datatypes.

A relation to express the value of an indentifier as a string (it can be used as alternative to or in combination with the s4inma:hasIdentifier object property. An unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context. A set of numbers, letters, or symbols that is used to represent uniquely an Entity or something. ID are custom or business-level defined.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: hasIdentifierValue

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A relation to express the value of an IRDI as a string
A relation to express the model number of a certain object (item, product, equipment, etc.)

A relation to describe the serial number of a certain Item, which is unique per Item. One of a set of numbers that is printed on Component, Physical System or Platform, etc. so that each has a different number and can be recognized.
A relation to express the value of an UUID as a string.
An item has a certain revision or version number, whereas a higher number indicates a newer version.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Everything used as a factor in an event (cause).
An entity is a physical, digital, conceptual, or other kind of thing with some fixed aspects; entities may be real or imaginary Platform, Component, System are example of Entities.
Application Programming Interface
AUTOTEST state.
Atomic piece of infrastructure. One of the parts of a System, process, or Platform. Example : processor.
Database Management System Server.
If the entity has lots of defects, it leads to failure or causes failure... Human mistakes cause fault.
Configuration of an embedded sensor hosted on a platform or a device.

All the materials and durable goods of the company must be inventoried, classified and codified in order to constitute a nomenclature. Such a nomenclature will facilitate the establishment of maintenance budgets, the establishment of preventive maintenance plans and more generally maintenance methods.
An Error is a mistake made in the entity.

A failure is the manner in which an item or operation potentially fails to meet or deliver the intended function and associated requirements. Depending on the definition of failure established by the analysis team, failure modes may include failure to perform a function within defined limits, inadequate or poor performance of the function, intermittent performance of a function, and/or performing an unintended or undesired function. There may be many failure modes for each function.
The Fault is a state that causes the entity to fail to accomplish its essential function.

The service must have a general documentation service, updated regularly. This includes all the technical documents which are not assigned to specific equipment, but which are necessary for maintenance personnel to answer more general technical questions.

This is the part of the maintenance documentation that records failures, breakdowns and information relating to the maintenance of an asset. The history of a piece of equipment. It traces the life of the equipment by chronologically indicating all the key maintenance events as well as the improvements that have been made to the equipment since it was put into service.

It comes from the operational phase of the life cycle, the phase during which maintenance is carried out. It is therefore rich in information and it is up to each company to build it. The maintenance plan should only include what is strictly necessary for maintenance personnel in their daily activities.

The Planning phase is all about identifying the shutdown work scope, then identifying parts, labor, equipment and other resources required to carry out the shutdown. The output of the planning phase is a set of comprehensive shutdown work packs, assurance that everything is available to carry out the work.
Configuration of a nonintrusive sensor opertaing remotly.
RUNNING state.
Sensor configuration : Remote, Embedded
Physical size observable property.
It breaks down into four main parts: * The equipment nomenclature or inventory of the equipment park, * The technical equipment file, * The equipment maintenance plan, * The history file.
System reaction to an event

technical files is the first documentation from which all other technical files will be created. It is therefore the one that must be as complete as possible and that should be defined in the equipment purchasing specifications. Why ? Quite simply because you need to have this documentation as soon as the equipment arrives at the company to be installed there, and experience shows that if it does not arrive with it, there is little chance of recovering it. Indeed, such documentation is expensive for the supplier, and he will "always drag his feet" to do so. achieve as a whole. This source documentation must be part of the customer-supplier contractual requirements because it is the maintenance personnel who are most likely to suffer from the lack of documentation
A temporal entity with zero extent or duration
owl:Class.rdfs:label: TimeInstant

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A temporal entity with an extent or duration
owl:Class.rdfs:label: TimeInterval

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A temporal interval or instant.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: TemporalEntity

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Platform is an entity that hosts other entities : components, systems or other platforms. Example : Server, computer, etc. A post, buoy, vehicle, ship, aircraft, satellite, cell-phone, human or animal may act as platforms for (technical or biological) sensors or actuators.
System is a unit of abstraction for pieces of infrastructure that implement Procedures. A System may have components, its subsystems, which are other systems.
An agent (eg. person, group, software or physical artifact).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Agent

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A document.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Document

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A class of Agents.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Group

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An organization.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Organization

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A person.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Person

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A function that allows to transmit data to actuators, such as level settings (e.g., temperature) or binary switching (e.g., open/close, on/off)
A device responsible for moving or controlling a mechanism or system by performing an actuating function

A tangible object designed to accomplish a particular task. In order to accomplish this task, the device performs one or more functions. For example, a washing machine is designed to wash (task) and to accomplish this task it performs a start and stop function.
The unit of measure for energy
A function that allows to notify about some relevant activity; e.g., that a certain threshold value has been exceeded or that some object has moved.
A feature of interest represents any real world entity from which a property is measured.

The functionality necessary to accomplish the task for which a device is designed. A device can be designed to perform more than one function. Functions can be structured in categories (subclasses) that reflect different points of view, for example, considering the specific application area for which a function can be used (e.g., light, temperature, motion, heat, power, etc.), or the capability that a function can support (e.g., receive, reply, notify, etc.), and so forth.
The unit of measure for light
An actuating function that allows to do level adjustments of a property in a certain range (e.g., 0%-100%), such as dimming a light in a room or setting the speed of an electric motor.

A switch that performs the saref:OnOffFunction, controls the property saref:Light, and can be found in the state saref:OnOffState. It can offer a switch on service. A saref:LightSwitch is typically used to accomplish saref:Lighting.
Represents the measured value made over a property. It is also linked to the unit of measure in which the value is expressed and the timestamp of the measurement.
A function that allows to get data from a meter, such as current meter reading or instantaneous demand
A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a unit of measure for motion
A type of state
The state of a device that is Off
An actuating function that allows to switch on and off an actuator
A type of state
The state of a device that is On
An actuating function that allows to open and close a device
The unit of measure for power.
The unit of measure for pressure

An aspect of an entity that can be observable by a sensor. A quality of a feature of interest that can be measured; an aspect of a feature of interest that is intrinsic to and cannot exist without the feature.
A function that allows to transmit data from sensors, such as measurement values (e.g., temperature) or sensing data (e.g., occupancy).

A device that detects and responds to events or changes in the physical environment such as light, motion, or temperature changes. Further, a device of category saref:Sensor that performs a saref:SensingFunction.
Device, agent or software responding to a change in the environment and generate a result. Sensors can be hosted by Platforms. Alias : Instrument. Example : Barometers.

A service is a representation of a function to a network that makes the function discoverable, registerable, remotely controllable by other devices in the network. A service can represent one or more functions. A Service is offered by a device that wants (a certain set of) its function(s) to be discoverable, registerable, remotely controllable by other devices in the network. A Service must specify the device that is offering the service and the function(s) to be represented.

A sensor that performs the saref:SensingFunction and the saref:EventFunction, and is used for the purpose of sensing a property of type saref:Smoke. A saref:SmokeSensor is typically used to saref:accomplish saref:Safety.
The state of a device that is STARTED
An actuating function that allows to start and stop a device
A type of state
The state in which a device can be found, e.g, ON/OFF/STANDBY, or ONLINE/OFFLINE. We propose here a list of states that are relevant for the purpose of SAREF, but this list can be extended.
The state of a device that is STOPPED
A device of category saref:Actuator that performs an actuating function of type saref:OnOffFunction or saref:OpenCloseFunction
A type of service that represents an on/off function to the network

The goal for which a device is designed (from a user perspective). For example, a washing machine is designed for the task of washing. We propose here a list of tasks that are relevant for the purpose of SAREF, but this list can be extended. Tasks can be accomplished by devices (saref:isAccomplishedBy).
A sensor that is used for the purpose of sensing a property of type saref:Temperature. A saref:TemperatureSensor is typically used to saref:accomplish saref:Comfort.
The unit of measure for temperature

The unit of measure is a standard for measurement of a quantity, such as a Property. For example, Power is a property and Watt is a unit of power that represents a definite predetermined power: when we say 10 Watt, we actually mean 10 times the definite predetermined power called "watt". Our definition is based on the definition of unit of measure in the Ontology of units of Measure (OM). We propose here a list of some units of measure that are relevant for the purpose of SAREF, but this list can be extended, also using some other ontologies rather than the Ontology of units of Measure (OM).

A building represents a structure that provides shelter for its occupants or contents and stands in one place. The building is also used to provide a basic element within the spatial structure hierarchy for the components of a building project (together with site, storey, and space).
An entity used to define the physical spaces of the building. A building space contains devices or building objects.
Any Object that has a proper space region. (Definition extracted from DUL ontology)

A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value measured in an energy unit (such as Kilowatt_Hour or Watt_hour).
saref:Energy : Energy type and value in a slot (i.e., Energy, EnergyMin, EnergyMax, EnergyStandardDeviation, EnergySkewness),
owl:Class.rdfs:label: EnergyProperty

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a power unit (such as watt or kilowatt).
saref4ener:Power : Power type and value in a slot (i.e. power, powerMin, powerMax, powerExpectedValue, powerStandardDeviation, powerSkewness)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: PowerProperty

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An aspect of light that can be observable by a sensor.
Describes whether the measurement is actually measured during the production process. Disjoint with ExpectedMeasurement.

A subclass of s4bldg:BuildingSpace used to define the physical spaces of the building. According to IEC 62264, areas are physical, geographical or logical groupings of resources determined by the site. A site can be divided in areas, whereas areas contain work centers.
Describes whether the measurement is expected (i.e., planned before the production process). Disjoint with ActualMeasurement.

A subclass of s4bldg:Building specialized for the purpose of SAREF4INMA, a factory represents one or more organizations sharing a definit mission, goals and objectives which provides an output such as a product (definition taken from IEC 62264). A factory can be divided in one or multiple sites.
A unique identifier.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Identifier

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: International Registration Data Identifier (IRDI) is based on the international standards ISO/IEC 11179-6, ISO 29002 and ISO 6532 and used in eCl@ss and the Asset Administration Shell as unique identifier.

A subclass of saref:Measurement that represents the measured value made over a property. It is also linked to the unit of measure in which the value is expressed and the timestamp of the measurement. The saref4imna:Measurement can be linked to individual Batches or Items. Moreover, the Measurement can be an ExpectedMeasurement (i.e. the value which is planned) or the ActualMeasurement (i.e. the value measured during production), which enables to check for deviations between the planned and actual values.

A production equipment is a specialization of a saref:Device and s4bldg:PhysicalObject that can produce items in a manufacturing process. This class represents an individual production equipment device and includes their specification in terms of functions, states and services. Different types of machines can be defined under this class as needed, for example, LaserCuttingMachine (i.e., a type of production equipment to cut steel material), MillingMachine (i.e., to drill holes in steel material), MouldingMachine (i.e., to mold liquid material, such as iron or plastic, and let it harden in a certain shape), WeldingMachine (i.e., join parts of material, such as steel, together), etc.

A ProductionEquipmentCategory represents a certain type of production equipment, which is generally static over time. More concretely, the ProductionEquipmentCategory represents a certain model and brand of a production equipment. Each ProductionEquipmentCategory can have multiple related ProductionEquipment, which represent the actual individual machines. Moreover, each ItemCategory can be produced by multiple ProductionEquipmentCategories.
Functionallity neccessary to accomplish the task for which a production equipment is designed.

A subclass of s4bldg:BuildingSpace used to define the physical spaces of the building. According to IEC 62264, sites are identified physical, geographical, and/or logical component groupings of a manufacturing enterprise. A factory can be divided in sites, whereas sites can be divided areas

A universally unique identifier (UUID) is a 128-bit number used to identify items and is also known as: globally unique identifier (GUID). In its canonical textual representation, the sixteen octets of a UUID are represented as 32 hexadecimal (base 16) digits, displayed in five groups separated by hyphens, in the form 8-4-4-4-12 for a total of 36 characters (32 alphanumeric characters and four hyphens). UUID are documented in ISO/IEC 11578:1996 "Information technology Open Systems Interconnection Remote Procedure Call (RPC)" and in ITU-T Rec. X.667 | ISO/IEC 9834-8:2005.

A subclass of s4inma:ProductionEquipment (and therefore of s4bld:PhysicalObject). It is an equipment element under an area in a role-based equipment hierarchy that performs production, storage or material movement (definition taken from IEC 62264). An Area contains work centers.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Acceleration magnitude.
Average speed magnitude.
A type of task for which a device is designed
A type of task for which a device is designed
A type of task for which a device is designed
An individual representing the nominal operating energy property EnergyNominal.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: EnergyNominalValue

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Instantaneous speed magnitude.
An individual representing the property length.
X axis acceleration magnitude.
An individual representing the power property Power nominal value.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: PowerNominalValue

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: A type of task for which a device is designed

It is of course based on experience and progressive knowledge of the material. The first step is to score each piece of equipment according to different criteria. for example : - Technological complexity (simple, complex, sophisticated) - Complexity of operation (no training necessary, simple training, significant training) - Criticality in the process (unimportant, main, strategic) - Operating rate (low, intermittent, continuous) - Cost of production losses (inexpensive, expensive, very expensive) - Replacement value (inexpensive, expensive, very expensive)
Speed magnitude.
Y axis acceleration magnitude.
A type of task for which a device is designed
Z axis acceleration magnitude.
An individual representing the property width.
An individual representing the maximum energy consumption property EnergyMax.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: EnergyMaxValue

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: An individual representing the minimum energy consumption property EnergyMin.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: EnergyMinValue

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: An individual representing the energy skewness property EnergySkewness.
An individual representing the energy standard deviation property EnergyStandardDeviation.
An individual representing the power property Power max value.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: PowerMaxValue

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: An individual representing the power property Power min value.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: PowerMinValue

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: An individual representing the power property Power skewness.
An individual representing the power property Power standard deviation.
An individual representing the light property fluorescence.
An individual representing the property frequency.
An individual representing the property height.
An individual representing the light property light magnitude.
An individual representing the light property luminiscence.
Property indicating material conductivity.
Property of a solution indicating its hydrogen ion concentration. pH is a scale used to specify the acidity or basicity of an aqueous solution.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: pH
